1.text: But we ought, we that are strong, to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

2.text: Let each one of us please his neighbour with a view to what is good, to edification.

3.text: For the Christ also did not please himself; but according as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproach thee have fallen upon me.

4.text: For as many things as have been written before have been written for our instruction, that through endurance and through encouragement of the scriptures we might have hope.

5.text: Now the God of endurance and of encouragement give to you to be like-minded one toward another, according to Christ Jesus;

6.text: that ye may with one accord, with one mouth, glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

7.text: Wherefore receive ye one another, according as the Christ also has received you to [the] glory of God.

8.text: For I say that Jesus Christ became a minister of [the] circumcision for [the] truth of God, to confirm the promises of the fathers;

9.text: and that the nations should glorify God for mercy; according as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among [the] nations, and will sing to thy name.

10.text: And again he says, Rejoice, nations, with his people.

11.text: And again, Praise the Lord, all [ye] nations, and let all the peoples laud him.

12.text: And again, Esaias says, There shall be the root of Jesse, and one that arises, to rule over [the] nations: in him shall [the] nations hope.

13.text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that ye should abound in hope by [the] power of [the] Holy Spirit.

14.text: But I am persuaded, my brethren, I myself also, concerning you, that yourselves also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

15.text: But I have written to you the more boldly, [brethren,] in part, as putting you in mind, because of the grace given to me by God,

16.text: for me to be minister of Christ Jesus to the nations, carrying on as a sacrificial service the [message of] glad tidings of God, in order that the offering up of the nations might be acceptable, sanctified by [the] Holy Spirit.

17.text: I have therefore [whereof to] boast in Christ Jesus in the things which pertain to God.

18.text: For I will not dare to speak anything of the things which Christ has not wrought by me, for [the] obedience of [the] nations, by word and deed,

19.text: in [the] power of signs and wonders, in [the] power of [the] Spirit of God; so that I, from Jerusalem, and in a circuit round to Illyricum, have fully preached the glad tidings of the Christ;

20.text: and so aiming to announce the glad tidings, not where Christ has been named, that I might not build upon another’s foundation;

21.text: but according as it is written, To whom there was nothing told concerning him, they shall see; and they that have not heard shall understand.

22.text: Wherefore also I have been often hindered from coming to you.

23.text: But now, having no longer place in these regions, and having great desire to come to you these many years,

24.text: whenever I should go to Spain; (for I hope to see you as I go through, and by you to be set forward thither, if first I shall have been in part filled with your company;)

25.text: but now I go to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints;

26.text: for Macedonia and Achaia have been well pleased to make a certain contribution for the poor of the saints who [are] in Jerusalem.

27.text: They have been well pleased indeed, and they are their debtors; for if the nations have participated in their spiritual things, they ought also in fleshly to minister to them.

28.text: Having finished this therefore, and having sealed to them this fruit, I will set off by you into Spain.

29.text: But I know that, coming to you, I shall come in [the] fulness of [the] blessing of Christ.

30.text: But I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in prayers for me to God;

31.text: that I may be saved from those that do not believe in Judaea; and that my ministry which [I have] for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;

32.text: in order that I may come to you in joy by God’s will, and that I may be refreshed with you.

33.text: And the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
